basics.name: Michael F Vertuli
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Architecting big data pipelines, deploying machine learning models, and extracting insights with Scala, Spark, Python, and SQL.

highlights: Architected, implemented, deployed, and maintained large business-critical data pipelines in Hadoop with Hive, SQL, and Airflow.
Collaborated cross-functionally with product managers and marketing to deliver data dashboards and visualizations with Django in Python.
Designed and deployed predictive machine learning pipelines using Spark in Scala to model audience demographics and customer segmentation.
Conducted regular data investigations, regularly releasing Jupyter notebooks and giving company presentations.
Promoted twice within my first year and volunteered with recruitment efforts and engineering mentoring program.

work.location: Washington, DC, USA & Los Angeles, CA, USA
highlights: Worked with dozens of college and high school students to improve confidence and skills with math and physics between Washington, DC and Los Angeles, CA.
Redeveloped math syllabus to emphasize statistical thinking, real-world modeling, and practical applications, and coached the 9th grade boys' soccer team.
Founded a Shanghai-based education consultancy and lead a team of counselors, marketers, and account managers serving Shanghai's top students aiming to study abroad in the U.S.
Quickly pivoted from providing test preparation to fill a niche demand for long-term, holistic, and honest academic planning and guidance beyond test scores.
Developed data scraping tools to collect and process public application profiles and admissions data into Salesforce, helping inform our staff and track student metrics.
Standardized department assessments and developed system to track and report student metrics.
Assisted IT with implementing its first school management system (SIMS) and Moodle integration.

volunteer.summary: Raised funds for two child heart surgeries at annual student Battle of the Bands

education.summary: Analyzed fluorescence detector calibration data from the Pierre Auger Cosmic Ray Observatory using Python, MATLAB, and Mathematica to find anomalies.
Designed, collected, and analyzed data using Python and ROOT from an experiment measuring angular dependence of fluorescence scattering from a radioactive source.
Tutored physics, assisted with undergraduate mechanics course, and imaged metallic whiskers with scanning electron microscopes.
